Name: Oriental
Ingredients: 45 ml Straight rye whiskey (100 proof /50% alc./vol.)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of orange zest twist.
EXPRESS orange zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: Be warned, this lightly sour, orangey whiskey-based cocktail packs a punch.
History: Adapted from the 1930 The Savoy Cocktail Book where author Harry Craddock , writes of this drink, " In August, 1924, an American Engineer nearly died of fever in the Philippines, and only the extraordinary devotion of Dr. B– saved his life. As an act of gratitude the Engineer gave Dr. B– the recipe of this cocktail. " This recipe first appears in Count Benvenito Martini's 1916 book Cocktail Ology .
Nutrition: One serving of Oriental contains 209 calories
